current_text: The 1.1°C increase in global temperature confirms the warming trajectory predicted by climate models and makes the 1.5°C threshold increasingly difficult to meet.
upstream_old_text: The global average temperature has increased by 1.1°C compared to the pre-industrial period.
upstream_new_text: The global average temperature has increased by 1.3°C compared to the pre-industrial period, according to revised 2024 data.
goal: Update the insight to reflect the new warming value

current_text: Launch a European investment plan of 50 billion euros over 5 years dedicated to energy storage to increase flexibility capacity from 0.3% to at least 10% of grid needs by 2030.
upstream_old_text: The energy storage capacity deficit (0.3% of needs) constitutes the main technical bottleneck of the transition.
upstream_new_text: Energy storage capacity in Europe reached 2.1% of grid flexibility needs in 2024, but remains far too insufficient to effectively integrate intermittent renewables.

current_text: Global greenhouse gas emissions reached 59.1 gigatons of CO2 equivalent in 2021, a 12% increase compared to 2010.
upstream_old_text: Global greenhouse gas emissions reached a record level of 59.1 gigatons of CO2 equivalent in 2021.
upstream_new_text: Global greenhouse gas emissions reached 62.3 gigatons of CO2 equivalent in 2022, a new all-time record according to the IPCC report.

current_text: Europe faces a dual risk of strategic dependence: after Russian gas, it is the dependence on China for energy transition components (solar panels, wind turbines) that constitutes a major vulnerability.
upstream_old_text: 82% of solar panels installed in Europe are manufactured in China.
upstream_new_text: The share of Chinese-origin solar panels installed in Europe decreased to 68% in 2024, thanks to new production capacities from Meyer Burger and Enel Green Power.
goal: Update the insight by incorporating the reduction in Chinese dependence

current_text: Create regional strategic food reserves covering 90 days of consumption in the European areas most vulnerable to supply disruptions.
upstream_old_text: Climate change creates a vicious cycle on food systems: declining agricultural yields and falling global cereal production worsen global food insecurity, while increasing import costs.
upstream_new_text: Global cereal production rebounded by 4.2% in 2024, but yields in Southern Europe remain 12% below the ten-year average, maintaining regional vulnerability despite the overall improvement.
goal: Update the recommendation by incorporating the overall improvement but the persistent vulnerability of Southern Europe

current_text:
## 1. Massive investment in energy storage

A plan of **50 billion euros over 5 years** is needed to increase storage capacity from 0.3% to 10% of grid needs by 2030.
upstream_old_text: Launch a European investment plan of 50 billion euros over 5 years dedicated to energy storage to increase flexibility capacity from 0.3% to at least 10% of grid needs by 2030.
upstream_new_text: Launch a European investment plan of 35 billion euros over 4 years dedicated to energy storage to increase flexibility capacity from 2.1% to at least 15% of grid needs by 2030, leveraging the decline in battery costs.
goal: Update the report to reflect the revised plan

current_text: The carbon price in the EU ETS reached a record of 101 euros per ton in February 2023, compared to 25 euros in 2020.
upstream_old_text: The carbon price in the EU ETS reached a record of 101 euros per ton in February 2023.
upstream_new_text: The carbon price in the EU ETS stabilized around 72 euros per ton in 2024, after reaching 101 euros in 2023.

current_text: The rapid adoption of generative AI (from 12% to 55% in one year among the Fortune 500) reflects an unprecedented technological paradigm shift.
upstream_old_text: 55% of Fortune 500 companies launched at least one generative AI pilot project in 2023.

current_text: Set a binding timeline for the progressive elimination of fossil fuel subsidies in G20 countries (25% reduction by 2027, 75% by 2030) with reallocation of at least 15% of the savings toward international climate financing.
upstream_old_text: The gap between fossil fuel subsidies (7 trillion dollars) and climate financing (83.3 billion) reveals a fundamental inconsistency in global public policies.
upstream_new_text: Fossil fuel subsidies decreased to 5.8 trillion dollars in 2024 while climate financing reached 116 billion, but the gap remains at 50:1, revealing a persistent fundamental inconsistency despite progress.
goal: Update the recommendation to reflect the evolution of amounts while maintaining the urgency

current_text:
### 2. Industrial sovereignty over key components

The creation of a **European industrial alliance** for transition components (photovoltaic cells, wind turbine blades, electrolyzers) must be accompanied by progressive local content quotas: 20% in 2025, 40% in 2030.
upstream_old_text: Create a European industrial alliance for energy transition components with progressive local content quotas (20% in 2025, 40% in 2030) to reduce dependence on China.
upstream_new_text: Strengthen the European industrial Solar Alliance for energy transition components by raising local content quotas to 30% in 2025 and 55% in 2030, building on the new Meyer Burger and Enel Green Power factories.
goal: Update the report to reflect the revised quotas and the existing alliance
